alert.note: Alert for La Paz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 29 at 5:21PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MST/830 PM PDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of west central Arizona and California, including the following counties, in west central Arizona, La Paz. In California, Imperial and Riverside. * WHEN...Until 830 PM MST /830 PM PDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 521 PM MST /521 PM PDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Colorado River, Milpitas Wash, Vinagre Wash, Crazy Woman Wash and Julian Wash. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cibola and Palo Verde. Highway 78 south of Palo Verde. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
